Articles.Content:
I looked over and saw this:

![nFD4Q64.png](http://i.imgur.com/nFD4Q64.png)

Actually it got worse, her eyes appearing through her upper lips as her carefree grin became maniacal expression bordering on tortured macabre... well you get the point...

Her teeth appear through her lower jaw from time to time too.

Has this actually gone unnoticed so far? It kinda freaked me out actually...

I've had the top of the 'smile' clip through the eyeballs before

It was terrifying

On the other end of things, I've had female Kerbals pull completely deadpan expressions with no animation for uncomfortable amounts of time, even while their male counterparts continue to do their idle animations (adjusting helmets and dancing in their seats). The female Kerbals are just...sitting there...and staring at me...

> 
> I looked over and saw this:
> [http://i.imgur.com/nFD4Q64.png](http://i.imgur.com/nFD4Q64.png)
> 
> Actually it got worse, her eyes appearing through her upper lips as her carefree grin became maniacal expression bordering on tortured macabre... well you get the point...
> 
> Her teeth appear through her lower jaw from time to time too.
> 
> Has this actually gone unnoticed so far? It kinda freaked me out actually...

And you didn't notice they lack a tongue?

> 
> And you didn't notice they lack a tongue?

Good

otherwise it would be back seat driver time ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Boris
Hey! No misogyny in my thead buddy!

A distant parent ?

![284161mouthteeth01.gif](http://img15.hostingpics.net/pics/284161mouthteeth01.gif)

(I'll send a few easy green coins to the first user posting this little buddy's name and where he comes from.)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-03T02:51:15Z" title="08/03/2015 02:51  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 3, 2015</time> by Plume & Akakak**

That's Fizzgig from the 1982 movie The Dark Crystal.

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/p0iRbfxPpVY?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

No, I'm not some kind of walking, talking movie database. My google-foo is just a bit above average.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-02T18:52:13Z" title="08/02/2015 06:52  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 2, 2015</time> by Tex\_NL**

> 
> He's Fizzgig from the 1982 movie The Dark Crystal.
> 
> 
> 
> <iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/p0iRbfxPpVY?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
> 
> No, I'm not some kind of walking, talking movie database. My google-foo is just a bit above average.

I had to check the exact spelling of his name too. : )

What a great movie, by the way.

Congratulations, your prize is waiting for you at the upper-right corner of the screen !

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-03T02:53:13Z" title="08/03/2015 02:53  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 3, 2015</time> by Plume & Akakak**

It's been a long time since I saw that movie last. I might venture to the darker corners of the web and see if I can download a decent copy.

Back in the day it made quite an impression on me. I remember watching this movie for the first time at a birthday party in elementary school in the early 80's.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-02T19:56:43Z" title="08/02/2015 07:56  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 2, 2015</time> by Tex\_NL**
  
typo

I was in elementary school and saw it for the first time in the early 80s too. I must have watched it more than 20 times since.

It was a fascinating/intimidating experience for me, and apparently for most people who saw it when they were children.

Back on topic (sorta), here's the guy still holding the title. A closer relative, most certainly.

[http://www.dailymotion.com/video/x116o18_classic-sesame-street-grover-s-health-minute-teeth_fun](https://www.dailymotion.com/video/x116o18_classic-sesame-street-grover-s-health-minute-teeth_fun)

Female Kerbals don't quite equip their EVA packs as good as males; The EVA packs were possibly more than likely animated to be used by Males only, and whilst Squad have done their best to animate Female kerbals with nearly the same animation, their hands and EVA Pack don't go quite as smooth.

That probably made no sense, but next time you are controlling a Female Kerbal in EVA, press 'E' (to equip the EVA Pack) and watch the Kerbal's hands and the little controls on the EVA Pack.

> 
> That's Fizzgig from the 1982 movie The Dark Crystal.
> 
> 
> 
> <iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/p0iRbfxPpVY?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
> 
> No, I'm not some kind of walking, talking movie database. My google-foo is just a bit above average.

You need Google to remember Kara's pet Fizzgig? (inconspicuously slides a chair in front of the 'D' section of his DVD collection)

Then again, I suppose I should not be terribly disappointed that it took 15 minutes for someone to identify the character using Google, it is more of a fantasy than sci-fi movie after all...

> 
> You need Google to remember Kara's pet Fizzgig? (inconspicuously slides a chair in front of the 'D' section of his DVD collection)
> Then again, I suppose I should not be terribly disappointed that it took 15 minutes for someone to identify the character using Google, it is more of a fantasy than sci-fi movie after all...

I remembered it from the Dark Crystal movie, but I didn't remember it's name.

> 
> You need Google to remember Kara's pet Fizzgig? (inconspicuously slides a chair in front of the 'D' section of his DVD collection)
> Then again, I suppose I should not be terribly disappointed that it took 15 minutes for someone to identify the character using Google, it is more of a fantasy than sci-fi movie after all...

1. Her name is Kira, not Kara.
2. It didn't take me 15 minutes to find it.  
Yes, there is a 15 minute gap between Plume's question and my answer but that doesn't mean I spent all that time searching. It only took me a few minutes to find the correct name.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-03T15:56:26Z" title="08/03/2015 03:56  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 3, 2015</time> by Tex\_NL**
  
typo

The Male's teeth wil also sometimes poke throught their skin as well. Not to mention one of the eyes of the male Kerbals is *still* floating off their head.

 ![izvc9Ym.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/izvc9Ym.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-03T16:06:05Z" title="08/03/2015 04:06  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 3, 2015</time> by klesh**
  
better picture.
Being a Kerbal seems incredibly painful. Maybe those insane smiles are actually terrible grimaces?

> 
> On the other end of things, I've had female Kerbals pull completely deadpan expressions with no animation for uncomfortable amounts of time, even while their male counterparts continue to do their idle animations (adjusting helmets and dancing in their seats). The female Kerbals are just...sitting there...and staring at me...

![200_s.gif](https://media1.giphy.com/media/MDw2JkJofdmZq/200_s.gif)

They might be doing this.

> 
> Being a Kerbal seems incredibly painful. Maybe those insane smiles are actually terrible grimaces?

Maybe they're made of something which can rearrange itself into what ever shape it wants. So when bits poke out, it's not damaged.

> 
> Maybe they're made of something which can rearrange itself into what ever shape it wants. So when bits poke out, it's not damaged.

Doesn't mean it's not incredibly painful. I can never look at Kerbals the same now... ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)
I don't mind the Kermit look of Kerbals, but crappy animations like this are unacceptable. #PutYour(Kerbal)MouthWhereYouyMoneyIsSquad

> 
> Back on topic (sorta), here's the guy still holding the title. A closer relative, most certainly.
> [http://www.dailymotion.com/video/x116o18_classic-sesame-street-grover-s-health-minute-teeth_fun](https://www.dailymotion.com/video/x116o18_classic-sesame-street-grover-s-health-minute-teeth_fun)

That's Kermit the Frog! Give me rep please. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Seriously, the animation bugs are creepy. Squad, please fix them. There will be loads of time after 1.1. Your devs are getting less and less work. The male kerbal animations have never glitched out on me.

> 
> That's Kermit the Frog! Give me rep please. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Well no. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I don't mind those glitches. I've used this picture as an avatar for a long time :

![850814skakakyrim01.jpg](http://img11.hostingpics.net/pics/850814skakakyrim01.jpg)

Oh the sweet intriguing indecency of anatomy atlases and sectional drawings.

Also, glitches can be fine. That's just the material expressing itself. Like splinters on a wooden floor make a room more lively.

Looks like her upper denture is about to fall out. lol
